contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=November 2007}} <!-- Deleted image removed: [[image:wisenut.png|thumb|Screen shot of WiseNut {{deletable image-caption|Wednesday, 16 November 2011}}]] --> '''WiseNut''' was a [[Web crawler|crawler]]-based [[search engine]] owned by [[Looksmart]]. It debuted as a beta in July 2001 and was officially launched in September 2001. It used its own database, and when it started it was highly regarded by a number of critics{{Citation needed|date=November 2007}}. WiseNut introduced a fresh database and relevant hits{{Citation needed|date=November 2007}}. Like [[Teoma]], WiseNut automatically clustered search results, a technology called ''WiseGuide''. Despite its good start, WiseNut never managed to become a major search engine. It lacked boolean search in the standard search and other advanced search features. Unlike other search engines, WiseNut did not cache pages. Looksmart bought the search engine in April 2002 for $9 million with the aim of introducing a major search engine. The revamp was not successful. Despite delivering good relevancy{{Citation needed|date=November 2007}} and having a large database of over 1.5 billion [[Uniform Resource Identifier|URI]]s, WiseNut remained a small player. Wisenut closed for good on 28 September 2007. [[Category:Internet search engines]] [[Category:Internet properties established in 2001]] [[Category:2007 disestablishments]] {{searchengine-website-stub}}
